勸.definition: to advise; to urge; to try to persuade; to exhort; to console; to soothe

勸化.definition: to exhort (sb) to live a virtuous life (Buddhism); to beg for alms

勸告.definition: to advise; to urge; to exhort; exhortation; advice; CL:席[xi2]

勸善懲惡.definition: to encourage virtue and punish evil (idiom); fig. poetic justice; you get what's coming to you

勸導.definition: to advise; to attempt to convince

勸戒.definition: variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]

勸教.definition: to advise and teach; to persuade and instruct

勸服.definition: to persuade; to convince; to win (sb) over

勸架.definition: to mediate in a quarrel; to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down

勸解.definition: conciliation; mediation; to mollify; to propitiate; to reconcile

勸課.definition: to encourage and supervise (esp. state officials promoting agriculture)

勸農使.definition: envoy charge with promoting agriculture (in Han dynasty)

勸退.definition: to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)

勸酒.definition: to urge sb to drink alcohol

勸駕.definition: to urge sb to accept a post; to urge sb to agree to do sth
